00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 contextString.pl - Allow string-valued answers.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 Implements contexts for string-valued answers.
00024 
00025 You can add new strings to the context as needed
00026 via the Context()->strings->add() method.  E.g.,
00027 
00028     Context("String")->strings->add(Foo=>{}, Bar=>{alias=>"Foo"});
00029 
00030 Use string_cmp() to produce the answer checker(s) for your
00031 correct values.  Eg.
00032 
00033     ANS(string_cmp("Foo"));
00034 
00035 =cut
00036 
00037 loadMacros("MathObjects.pl");
00038 
00039 sub _contextString_init {context::String::Init()}; # don't load it again
00040 
00041 ##################################################
00042 
00043 package context::String::Variable;
00044 
00045 sub new {
00046   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00047   my $context = $equation->{context};
00048   my @strings = grep {not defined($context->strings->get($_)->{alias})}
00049                   $context->strings->names;
00050   my $strings = join(', ',@strings[0..$#strings-1]).' or '.$strings[-1];
00051   $equation->Error(["Your answer should be one of %s",$strings]);
00052 }
00053 
00054 ##################################################
00055 
00056 package context::String::Formula;
00057 our @ISA = qw(Value::Formula);
00058 
00059 sub parse {
00060   my $self = shift;
00061   foreach my $ref (@{$self->{tokens}}) {
00062     $self->{ref} = $ref;
00063     context::String::Variable->new($self->{equation}) if ($ref->[0] eq 'error'); # display the error
00064   }
00065   $self->SUPER::parse(@_);
00066 }
00067 
00068 package context::String::BOP::mult;
00069 our @ISA = qw(Parser::BOP);
00070 
00071 sub _check {
00072   my $self = shift;
00073   context::String::Variable->new($self->{equation}); # report an error
00074 }
00075 
00076 ##################################################
00077 
00078 package context::String;
00079 
00080 sub Init {
00081   my $context = $main::context{String} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Numeric");
00082   $context->{name} = "String";
00083   $context->{pattern}{number} = qr/^$/;
00084   $context->parens->clear();
00085   $context->variables->clear();
00086   $context->constants->clear();
00087   $context->operators->clear();
00088   $context->functions->clear();
00089   $context->strings->clear();
00090   $context->{parser}{Variable} = 'context::String::Variable';
00091   $context->{parser}{Formula}  = 'context::String::Formula';
00092   $context->operators->add(
00093     ' ' => {precedence => 3, associativity=>"left", type=>"bin", string => "*", class => 'context::String::BOP::mult'},
00094     '*' => {precedence => 3, associativity=>"left", type=>"bin", class => 'context::String::BOP::mult'}
00095   );
00096 
00097   main::PG_restricted_eval(<<'  END_EVAL');
00098     sub string_cmp {
00099       my $strings = shift;
00100       $strings = [$strings,@_] if (scalar(@_));
00101       $strings = [$strings] unless ref($strings) eq 'ARRAY';
00102       return map {String($_)->cmp(showHints=>0,showLengthHints=>0)} @{$strings};
00103     }
00104   END_EVAL
00105 
00106   main::Context("String");  ### FIXME:  probably should require author to set this explicitly
00107 }
00108 
00109 1;
